title: Disease QOL
purpose: Life with cardiovascular disease: symptoms, daily function, overall well-being

item.text: The KCCQ, SAQ, and EmPHasis questionnaires are patient-centered, disease-specific tools that measure symptoms, functional status, and quality of life in people with different forms of cardiovascular disease.

valueCoding.display: Pulmonary Hypertension (high blood pressure in the arteries of the lungs)
Heart Failure (any type, including reduced or preserved ejection fraction)
Coronary Artery Disease & Angina (including stable ischemic heart disease, heart attack)

item.text: Have you been diagnosed with any of the following conditions?

EmPHasis-10: 
This questionnaire is designed to determine how Pulmonary Hypertension (PH) affects your life. Please answer every question by marking the number that best describes your recent experience of living with PH.

EmPHasis-10: 
Please mark the number that best describes your experience

valueCoding.display: 0 - I am not frustrated by my breathlessness
5 - I am very frustrated by my breathlessness

item.text:
EmPHasis-10: 
Please mark the number that best describes your experience

valueCoding.display: 0 - Being breathless never interrupts my conversations
5 - Being breathless always interrupts my conversations

item.text:
EmPHasis-10: 
Please mark the number that best describes your experience

valueCoding.display: 0 - I do not need to rest during the day
5 - I always need to rest during the day

item.text:
EmPHasis-10: 
Please mark the number that best describes your experience

EmPHasis-10: 
Please mark the number that best describes your experience

valueCoding.display: 5 - I have no energy at all

item.text:
EmPHasis-10: 
Please mark the number that best describes your experience

valueCoding.display: 0 - When I walk up one flight of stairs I am not breathless
5 - When I walk up one flight of stairs I am very breathless

item.text:
EmPHasis-10: 
Please mark the number that best describes your experience

valueCoding.display: 0 - I am confident out in public places/crowds despite my PH
5 - I am not confident at all in public places/crowds because of my PH

item.text:
EmPHasis-10: 
Please mark the number that best describes your experience

valueCoding.display: 0 - PH does not control my life

item.text:
EmPHasis-10: 
Please mark the number that best describes your experience

EmPHasis-10: 
Please mark the number that best describes your experience

valueCoding.display: 0 - I never feel like a burden
5 - I always feel like a burden

item.text: Please complete the following questions about your pulmonary hypertension specific treatments. This will allow us to better understand the impact of pulmonary hypertension of your daily routine.
Do you currently take pulmonary hypertension specific medications?
How many drugs are currently prescribed to you specifically for your pulmonary hypertension?
What type of medication do you currently take for your pulmonary hypertension? (Select all that apply)
How many times a day do you currently take one or more of your pulmonary hypetension medication(s)?
What time of day do you take your medicine? (Select all that apply)

KCCQ-12:
The following questions refer to your heart failure and how it may affect your life. Please read and complete the following questions. There are no right or wrong answers. Please mark the answer that best applies to you.

KCCQ-12
Heart failure affects different people in different ways. Some feel shortness of breath while others feel fatigue. Please indicate how much you are limited by heart failure (shortness of breath or fatigue) in your ability to do the following activities over the past 2 weeks.
Showering/bathing

valueCoding.display: Limited for other reasons or did not do the activity

item.text: Walking 1 block on level ground

valueCoding.display: Limited for other reasons or did not do the activity

item.text: Hurrying or jogging (as if to catch a bus)

valueCoding.display: Limited for other reasons or did not do the activity

item.text:
KCCQ-12:
Over the past 2 weeks, how many times did you have swelling in your feet, ankles or legs when you woke up in the morning?

valueCoding.display: 3 or more times per week but not every day

item.text:
KCCQ-12:
Over the past 2 weeks, on average, how many times has fatigue limited your ability to do what you wanted?

valueCoding.display: 3 or more times per week but not every day

item.text:
KCCQ-12:
Over the past 2 weeks, on average, how many times has shortness of breath limited your ability to do what you wanted?

valueCoding.display: 3 or more times per week but not every day

item.text:
KCCQ-12:
Over the past 2 weeks, on average, how many times have you been forced to sleep sitting up in a chair or with at least 3 pillows to prop you up because of shortness of breath?

valueCoding.display: 3 or more times per week but not every day

item.text:
KCCQ-12:
Over the past 2 weeks, how much has your heart failure limited your enjoyment of life?

valueCoding.display: It has extremely limited my enjoyment of life
It has limited my enjoyment of life quite a bit
It has moderately limited my enjoyment of life
It has slightly limited my enjoyment of life
It has not limited my enjoyment of life at all

item.text:
KCCQ-12:
If you had to spend the rest of your life with your heart failure the way it is right now, how would you feel about this?

KCCQ-12:
How much does your heart failure affect your lifestyle? Please indicate how your heart failure may have limited your participation in the following activities over the past 2 weeks.
Hobbies, recreational activities

valueCoding.display: Does not apply or did not do for other resons

item.text: Working or doing household chores

valueCoding.display: Does not apply or did not do for other resons

item.text: Visiting family or friends out of your home

valueCoding.display: Does not apply or did not do for other resons

item.text:
SAQ-7:
The following is a list of activities that people often do during the week. Although for some people with several medical problems it is difficult to determine what it is that limits them, please go over the activities listed below and indicate how much limitation you have had due to chest pain, chest tightness or angina over the past 4 weeks.
Walking indoors on level ground

valueCoding.display: Limited for other reasons or did not do the activity

item.text: Gardening, vacuuming or carrying groceries

valueCoding.display: Limited for other reasons or did not do the activity

item.text: Lifting or moving heavy objects (e.g. furniture, children)

valueCoding.display: Limited for other reasons or did not do the activity

item.text:
SAQ-7:
Over the past 4 weeks, on average, how many times have you had chest pain, chest tightness or angina?

valueCoding.display: 3 or more times per week but not every day

item.text:
SAQ-7:
Over the past 4 weeks, on average, how many times have you had to take nitroglycerin (nitroglycerin tablets or spray) for your chest pain, chest tightness or angina?

valueCoding.display: 3 or more times per week but not every day

item.text:
SAQ-7:
Over the past 4 weeks, how much has your chest pain, chest tightness or angina limited your enjoyment of life?

valueCoding.display: It has extremely limited my enjoyment of life
It has limited my enjoyment of life quite a bit
It has moderately limited my enjoyment of life
It has slightly limited my enjoyment of life
It has not limited my enjoyment of life at all

item.text:
SAQ-7:
If you had to spend the rest of your life with your chest pain, chest tightness or angina the way it is right now, how would you feel about this?
Have the medications you have been taking to treat your condition changed in the last 3 months?
Thank you for completing this survey.
